author: mklement0
body:
Judging by the _documented_ CLI - as reported by `powerhshell -?` - `-s` _should_ imply `-STA`, because it is the only option whose name starts with `s`.

However, there is an _undocumented_ `-servermode` switch that is _actually_ used when you pass just `-s`.

It looks like both options mistakenly define `-s` as an alias (see [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost/host/msh/CommandLineParameterParser.cs#L561) and [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.ConsoleHost/host/msh/CommandLineParameterParser.cs#L716)), which results in the first one being checked to be chosen (`-servermode`) rather than an error about an ambiguous parameter name having been used.

_Update_: I now see  that `-s` for `-servermode` is apparently used by PowerShell itself when spawning background processes for background jobs.

Therefore, the CLI help should be updated to at least mention that `-s` is short for `-servermode` and cannot be used as a shorthand for `-STA`.

title: CLI: -s is interpreted as -servermode, not as -STA; -servermode and its alias -s are not documented
